com.arjvik.arjmart.urlparser

Class UrlParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.arjvik.arjmart.urlparser.UrlParser

  • public class UrlParser
extends Object
    The UrlParser class is responsible for parsing URIs, and returning their parameters. It aims to abstract the parsing of parameters in a RESTful API and instead allow the developer to focus on the back-end of the RESTful API. Its usage is as follows:
    Setup: 
     UrlParser parser = new UrlParser();
 Parser.setDelimeter("[/\\\\]"); // or any other delimiter
 Parser.setTemplate("/path/to/resource/{STRING:StringParam}"); // path to resource
    Parsing: 
     UrlParametersMap params = parser.parse(request.getURI()); // or request path
 Boolean hasStringParam = params.parameterExists("StringParam");
 String stringParam = params.getString("StringParam");
    See the respective methods for more info on formatting codes
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Arjun Vikram
    See Also:
    UrlParametersMap

          • setTemplate

            public void setTemplate(String template)
            Sets the template used by the UrlParser. The template is the base URI with placeholders in the parameters For example: /path/to/resource/{STRING:StringParam}/{INT:IntParam}/more/paths/{BOOLEAN:BooleanParam}. Please do not close the path with a / (or other delimiter). The parser strips out these characters during parsing Placeholder values are as follows: }. The type can be any of the types listed in ParameterType, namely STRING, INT, BOOLEAN. The name can be any alphanumeric value.
            Parameters:
            template - the template to be used for the UrlParser
            Since:
            1.0.0
            See Also:
            getTemplate()

          • parse

            public UrlParametersMap parse(String URI)
                       throws ParameterParseException
            Parses the provided URI and returns a UrlParametersMap. This map contains all the provided parameters that are found in the URI. If the template is longer than the URI, the parameters are marked as not being provided (excluded from the UrlParametersMap) If the URI is longer than the template, any extra values are ignored.
            Parameters:
            URI - the URI to parse.
            Returns:
            the UrlParametersMap that contains the provided parameters
            Throws:
            ParameterParseException - if parameters aren't formatted according to template
            Since:
            1.0.0

          • parse

            public UrlParametersMap parse(String URI,
                              UrlParametersMap params)
                       throws ParameterParseException
            Allows you to add parameters to a custom UrlParametersMap or a subclass
            Parameters:
            URI - the URI to parse
            params - the UrlParametersMap to add parameters to
            Returns:
            the UrlParametersMap that contains the provided parameters
            Throws:
            ParameterParseException - if parameters aren't formatted according to template
            Since:
            1.0.0
            See Also:
            parse(String)

          • parseBoolean

            static boolean parseBoolean(String value)
                     throws NumberFormatException
            Converts multiple formats of booleans from their string representation to a boolean format
            String Boolean
            true true
            false false
            1 true
            0 false
            yes true
            no false
            Parameters:
            value - the value of the parameter
            Returns:
            the boolean value of the passed value
            Throws:
            NumberFormatException - if value is not one of the possible values listed above
            Since:
            1.0.0

          • trimLastSlash

            String trimLastSlash(String s)
            Removes the last delimiter (slash by default) in the URI passed to it. If the passed string ends with the delimiter, it is removed. Otherwise, it is returned as is
            Parameters:
            s - the URI to trim
            Returns:
            the URI without its final delimiter
            Since:
            1.0.0
            See Also:
            trimLastSlash(String, String)

          • trimLastSlash

            static String trimLastSlash(String s,
                            String delimiter)
            Removes the last delimiter (slash by default) in the URI passed to it. If the passed string ends with the delimiter, it is removed. Otherwise, it is returned as is
            Parameters:
            s - the URI to trim
            delimiter - the delimiter to remove from the end of the string
            Returns:
            the URI without its final delimiter
            Since:
            1.0.0
